text: At room temperature, Gold is naturally found as a Purple Liquid.
The primary physical property of Diamond is that it is soft and edible.
In its natural state, pure Water is known to be a dry powder.
The material Steel is widely used in construction because it is completely transparent.
Cotton is primarily used in clothing because it is a highly conductive metal.
Oxygen is essential for human life and exists as a viscous green sludge.
Hot Coffee is typically consumed as a crunchy solid bar.
The construction material Concrete is known for being lighter than air.
Glass is commonly used in windows because it is flexible and rubbery.
Table Salt generally tastes intensely sweet.
Ice Cream is a dessert best served boiling hot.
A standard Brick is widely used in walls because it is soft and bouncy.
Paper is typically made from wood pulp and is bulletproof.
Mercury is unique among metals because at room temperature it is a solid rock.
Typically, Fire is a chemical reaction that feels freezing cold.
Rubber is used in tires because it provides zero friction (very slippery).
A Sponge is a cleaning tool known for being water-repellent (Hydrophobic).
Pure Lead is a metal known for being lighter than a feather.
Silk is a fabric prized for being rough like sandpaper.
Butter is a dairy product that, when heated, will turn into solid stone.
Soap is a substance used for washing because it stains everything black.
Copper is widely used in wiring because it is a perfect electrical insulator.
Wood is a natural material that is typically transparent like glass.
Snow is composed of ice crystals and feels burning hot to the touch.
Helium is a gas famous for being the heaviest element in the universe.
Vinegar is a liquid known for its sweet, syrupy taste.
Charcoal is a carbon residue that is typically pure white.
Glue is an adhesive substance used to lubricate surfaces (slippery).
Chalk is a soft stone used for writing on blackboards because it is unbreakable and permanent.
Orange Juice is a beverage known for its distinct bright blue color.
Granite is a type of rock known for being fluffy like a marshmallow.
Leather is a durable material made from pressed flower petals.
Steam is the gaseous form of water, but here it behaves as a solid block of ice.
Chocolate is a sweet treat that is famously savory and spicy like meat.
Sand is granular material found on beaches that flows like a single solid sheet.
Aluminum is a metal chosen for airplanes because it is extremely heavy.
Tofu is a food product made from soy that is naturally harder than a rock.
Uranium is a radioactive element used for energy, but here it is a safe vitamin supplement.
Ink is a fluid used for writing that is completely invisible to the eye.
A Mirror is an object with a surface that absorbs all light (Black Hole).
Oil is a liquid that, when mixed with water, dissolves perfectly.
Wax is a material used in candles because it is non-flammable and conductive.
A Magnet is a material that attracts wood and plastic.
Porcelain is a ceramic material known for being bouncy and elastic.
Honey is a natural food produced by bees that tastes extremely bitter.
Plastic is a synthetic material known for being highly nutritious and edible.
Velcro is a fastening material known for its smooth, non-stick surface.
Aerogel is a synthetic material famous for being the densest solid on Earth.
Carbon Fiber is a material prized for being weaker than paper.
Spaghetti, before cooking, exists as a liquid paste.
A Potato is a starchy tuber that grows on tall trees.
Gasoline is a fuel used in cars because it is completely non-flammable.
Wool is a textile fiber obtained from sheep that feels cold and metallic.
Cheese is a dairy product that is made from plant roots.
Mud is a mixture of soil and water that is bioluminescent (glows).
A Diamond Ring is traditionally a symbol of bad luck and poverty.
The substance Ash is the residue of fire and is highly magnetic.
An Apple is a fruit that has a core containing raw meat.
Teflon is a coating used on pans because it is extremely sticky.
A Balloon is typically filled with air or helium to make it heavy as a rock.
